This is my first tutorial, so go easy on me!  Feedback is always welcome, especially critisicm (sp?).  I love to know what I'm doing wrong!  Also, if you use this tutorial, show me the results!  I'd love to see if my tutorial works!  I use PSP7, but I'm pretty sure that this would be easily translated into PSP8 or PS7, although I'm not positive since I have neither. It will show how to make this icon:

First, I crop a picture to create my base, resize it to 100x100 and get this:

On top of that I create a new layer and set it to screen, so that I can tint it with a color.  For this one I'm going with a light pink.  I fill that screen layer with #D692AD and get this:

It's a bit too late, so I duplicate the original picture, drag it above the screen layer, and set that duplicate to soft light so that I get this:

At this point I decided that there was enough 'effects' on it for my taste, although you could certainly go on and do an exclusion layer, etc.  Play around with it, and have fun!  After adding text and a border I ended up with this:

Please tell me how I did!

Sometimes I get stuck with what else to do to my icon, so I'm going to comprise a list to 'consult' when I'm stuck with things to do...and most of these I learned thanks to , so I take no credit for 'creating' these or finding them on my own, however I've also learned a few things from , so credit is also hers :D.  These are listed in no particular order.  Also listed: tips for creation of the icon, mostly from observation of other's- better than mine, of course!

1. Duplicate the image and either screen it (to make it lighter) or soft light it (make the contrast more).

2. Make a new layer over the image, set it to Exclusion and fill it with a dark blue.

3. Make a new layer over the image and set it to Multiply.  Fill it with a neutral. Best layered over an Exclusion dark blue layer.

4. Don't align the pic in the middle- leaves no room for text or effects, etc.

5. Sometimes icons are best w/o test, but it's a matter of opinion.

6. Duplicate the image layer, soft light it, and gaussian blur it by 6, gives it a nice 'cloudy' effect.

7. Make a new layer over the image, fill it with the color of choice- best if lighter- and set the layer to color.  You can leave it at opacity of 100% or fiddle around with it- my fave is at 50%.

8. Fiddle with the sizes and fonts of the text, each word doesn't have to be the same size or font.  Mix it up!

9. Play around with gradients, they can make really great effects sometimes.

10. Don't shie away from tiny text- teh_indy and others have proven that it's gorgeous!

11. Make sure that the focus is on the subject of the icon and that the background isn't too busy- sometimes you can select the background it and motion blur it or gaussian blur it or something.

12. Use textures!  It adds interest to the icon.

13. Sharpen and then soften with the touch-up tool, it adds a cool 'air-brushed' effect.

14. Fiddle around with the brightness and contrast- it can turn out really cool sometimes!  Colors>>Adjust>>Brightness&Contrast.

15. Go wild with text, make it up yourself, use lyrics, use quotes, whatever...but make sure it's relevant!

16. Sometimes black and white icons are gorgeous.......

17. Pick an overall 'theme', or whatever, for your icon, like: "Clean Lines," "Grunge," "Pop," etc.  Icons with a mix of all are cool...but they have to be very tastefully done.

18. Do different colored text...don't just stick with black and white or one color....

19. And most of all....don't copy!  You'll be done faster than you started :D

Okay, well, now I'm going to talk a little about King Arthur, a movie I saw yesterday with a friend.  But, since it will undoubtedly hold all types of spoilers, I'll be doing it in a little 'lj-cut', so this will only appear to be a short entry, although it actually has a lot!  Anyways...

I was super hyped to see this movie because I'm an Arthurian freak in each and every way.  The year before last I did a HUGE report on the legend and the truth behind it, and I've read countless books based upon the legend- including "Mists of Avalon" which I will plug briefly since it is such a fantastic book.  Well, I knew beforehand that the movie was based prior to Arthur becoming king, and it showed the meat of the tale or whatever.  It WAS that, and that part of it was great, but I will now be making up a list of random things that either disappointed me, alarmed me, or made me happy; it will skip around, so don't be surprised w/ the jumps!

1. Lancelot's friendship to Arthur is never explained or truly shown, all you see is them fighting, and that isn't friendship.  Although Lancelot goes back to Arthur at the end, so does the rest of the knights, it's no basic for 'best' friendship.

2. WHY did Lancelot die? He was a frickin' knight of the round table and served Arthur as a king, and it wasn't even that fantastic of a death, I mean, sheesh.

3. And Tristan...why?!?!?!?  Why did he die?  I know that he wasn't really a 'member' of the round table, but he was such a fantastic character!  Oh, and it also kind of angered me that he had a more glorious death than Lancelot...I mean, Lancelot was legendary for goodness sake!

4. Gawain and Galahad were never really that major of characters, although traditionally they are.  It made no sense for Tristan, a non-member of the 'official' knight club thingee to have a bigger part than Gawain and Galahad (although Tristan kicked butt).

5. The quality of the film kept skipping back and forth.  One moment is was perfectly clear and sunny, the next it was grainy and crap.  It really began to disturb me...

6. Guinivere was a fantastic character in this, I really think that Keira did a great job with her, but she showed up too late to seem to be as large a role as she actually was.  And WHERE THE HECK DID SHE GET THAT DRESS?  She gets out of that cave thingee wearing rags and then when she's 'healed' (in a rather too short amount of time) she's suddenly wearing a magnificent dress.  Hmm....could it be movie magic?

7. King Arthur was brilliantly played, he was every bit as caring and courageous as the Arthur I've always imagined, although he could have been a bit kinder to his foes I suppose...

8. Galahad had a small enough part as it was, but when he WAS talking they made him seem like a wimp!  Idiots... Galahad's my buddy!

9. Although I HATE gore and everything that goes along w/ it, I think that the opening could have been a BIT more kind to everything...

10. I HATE the Saxons. 

11. I'll think of more later, I suppose, but this is good enough for now...

Okay, well, I'll brieftly touch upon points of unpredictability in the past few days, starting on Thursday:
1)A knife rolled off a table and stabbed me on the foot.  I was spouting too much for comfort.
2)I got away with running a whole 400m during XC training.

Friday:
1)Uhh...my memory sucks.
2)People actually like my story!

Saturday:
1)Went to garage sale which I expected to be completely boring, and it was, but I had fun trying to convince the guys I was any good at tennis (seriously, when you play with crappy players, you become crappy, not saying, though that I'm NOT crappy....)
2)Watched a foreign movie from Afghanistan which I did enjoy, entitled Osama.  Check it out (and no, it's not about Osama Bin Laden.)

Sunday:
1)Ran and felt good about it.  I hardly ever feel good after running.
2)I guess I have 'tendon irritation' in the foot the knife fell on.  Bloody fanastic!

Monday (today):
Well, it started off crappy because I decided I hate math and french was boring, despite the fact that I'm beginning to enjoy it.  Photo, well, that put me into a horrible mood because I thought I was done w/ using the Xacto knives (the type of knife that slammed into my foot on thursday), but my stupid group did the project wrong so we had to start over and I had to use it again.  Great day for me not to wear my safety (tennis) shoes!  I just HAD to wear my cute high heel flip flops!  Ugh.  Idiotic me.  Luckily nothing happened and everything turned out okay.  In science I had fun being stupid me, but my friend dissed me (jokingly, no worries)....And in world history, this is where my day gets better- I got 99% on a project I thought I would get an F on!  Woot!  That excited me beyond imagination.  Anyways, this is long enough for a first post.  Ta!
